title: Open IORG
authorInfoItemsHTML: • Author = IORG
html:
Principles: open by default, public accountability

IORG believes that open information and civic participation are two core values of defending democracy. Research results, methodology, data, and code produced by IORG are open by default.

As a research body of information manipulation, IORG takes extra care before publishing information ourselves. For public accountability, IORG takes measures to ensure that we stay open and transparent. We conduct public-verifiable data science research, release open data, and disclose our research method. We hope that this could help earn trust from the public, and rebuild public discourse on the foundation of facts and science.

Knowledge is open if anyone is free to access, use, modify, and share it – subject, at most, to measures that preserve provenance and openness.

– Open Definition 2.1

“Open IORG” is our project to make the following items open:

  • Research reports and articles
  • Research methodology
  • Dictionaries
  • IORG Reading List
  • IORG Web Archive
  • IORG Archive
  • IORG Data Standard
  • IT tools
  • Interviews
  • Internal documents

Research reports and articles

Research reports and articles, authored by IORG, are unless otherwise noted, released under a CC BY-SA 4.0 International license via https://iorg.tw.

IORG Archive

For scientific research purposes, IORG collects data and metadata with automated or human processes from social media, instant messaging, and other web platforms. IORG Archive is built to preserve data for scientific research purposes.
